s.text: There's a Time /CNN poll out today that shows Gore a few points ahead of Bradley.
by referring to the goings-on at a chicken-processing plant as a "gang pluck."
The apparatus of the vice-presidency is too much to overcome, even this particular vice-presidency.

On the whole, the national press has a sneering stereotypical view of the state, which you'd think was overrun with oil-slicked bumpkins, tyrannical high-school football coaches, mechanical-bull-riding smoothies, and the odd computer geek, but no one sneers with more relish than the Times . Maybe it dates back to the trouble Molly Ivins had as the paper's Denver bureau chief.

The C.W. is that McCain hurts Bradley's chances, because independents can go this way or that and Bradley needs them all, but I think the reverse is true: Bradley is a drain on the potential pool of voters for McCain, who needs every single one to orchestrate an upset.
